data.title: Riddley Walker by Russell Hoban
data.meta_description: Riddley Walker by Hoban, Russell and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Hard Cover. Condition: VG. Dust Jacket Condition: VG. First Edition. First UK printing, jacket design by Mon Mohan. Light soil to outer edges, corner creasing (from an external bump), light tanning to paper and light creasing from page handling. Boards have light edge wear and light bump wear. DJ has edge/rub wear, light soiling, light creasing and the spine text has faded. Actual book for sale pictured. 14.5 x 22.4 x 2.5cm, wt600g One of the titles selected by Anthony Burgess for his book "99 Novels: The Best in English Since 1939". B4 nd u upon the berning bye bye hump u gotta reed this buk. Trubba not no kidda no Arga Warga! Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First Edition, Third Printing (Full Number Line). Not price-clipped ($13.95 price intact). Published by Summit Books, 1980. Octavo. Dark blue cloth over green boards stamped in gold. Book is very good; clean with no writing or names. Sharp corners and spine straight. Binding tight and pages crisp. Previous owner name on flyleaf and stamp on bottom page ends. Dust jacket is very good with light shelf wear, large tear on front cover and nicks. 220 pages. ISBN: 0671421476. 100% positive feedback. 30 day money back guarantee. NEXT DAY SHIPPING! Excellent customer service. Please email with any questions or if you would like a photo. All books packed carefully and ship with free delivery confirmation/tracking. All books come with free bookmarks. Ships from Southampton, New York.

HARDCOVER. Condition: F/VG+. FIRST EDITION. WINNER OF THE 1981 JOHN W. CAMPBELL AWARD BOOK IS FINE WITHOUT ANY MARKS TO THE BINDING OR THE TEXT EXPECT FOR A REMAINDER MARK TO TEXT BLOCK BOTTOM EDGE. D.J. HAS A COUPLE OF SHORT TEARS AT BASE OF FRONT PANEL, A TRACE OF RUB AT QUARTER BOUND JUNCTURE ON THE REAR PANEL, BUT IS OTHERWISE FINE AND IS NOT PRICE-CLIPPED. AN EXCELLENT CLEAN, BRIGHT, UNFADED COPY WITH NO REMAINDER MARK.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition/First Printing with the complete number line; A Near Fine book in a Near Fine price clipped dust jacket, with only light shelf wear to the board and panel edges, else F/F. An outstanding copy of this remarkable book, winner of the Campbell Award and nominated for the Nebula Award. Also included, a F/F copy of Hoban's "Pilgermann", another critically acclaimed work from this author. Neither book remaindered or ex-library; in a protective Mylar cover and will ship in a sturdy box.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. Tempe: Summit, 1980. First edition, first printing. 8vo. Cloth binding, 220 pp. Previous owner bookplate and rubbing to front endpaper. Very good in near fine dust jacket, protected with an archival-quality mylar cover. Size: 8vo.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Expanded Edition bound in blue cloth with silver title to spine. Issued without a dust jacket. Slight sunning to spine. Tight and clean. No markings. See our real pictures we use real photos not stock images.

FIRST EDITION. Half title. Orig. black cloth. Red, white & black printed d.w., clipped. A lovely bright copy. Hoban's novel of a post-apocalyptic Kent, set 2,000 years after a nuclear war, sees iron-age level societies fighting for scraps of knowledge, technology, and language. What survives of culture is a bizarre (but utterly believable) melange of Punch and Judy shows, the life of St Eustace, and nuclear myth. Written in a weird Chaucerian English drawn from his experiences as a teacher in Kent and his childhood in suburban Pennsylvania, Hoban alleged that it destroyed his ability to spell - words are mangled, degraded, and re-formed. An astonishing feat of imagination. Anthony Burgess said that while it 'could not expect to be popular. it seems to me a permanent contribution to literature'.

hardcover. Condition: fine. Dust Jacket Condition: fine. Limited. Some illustrations. 235 pages. 8vo, full red leather with gilt lettering and cover designs, gilt page edges, peach silk moire endpapers. Norwalk, Connecticut: Easton Press, (2010). Signed by Hoban on a preliminary page. A fine copy. Contains a personalizable Bookplate sticker, a publisher's note, and a Certificate of Authenticity signed by the author, the publisher and a witness.
